title: U NEVR BEAT D IRISH!
content:
Hello,

does someone recongize this font on RYANAIR's aircraft 'U NEVR BEAT D IRISH!"?

I had Akzidenz Grotesk but that's not it. Your input is much appreciated.

Best regards,  
C.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317181250im_/http:/typophile.com/files/boeing-737-8as-ei-exf_5364.jpg)

Font: 

 Frutiger Condensed Black 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317181250/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [boeing-737-8as-ei-exf.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317181250/http:/typophile.com/files/boeing-737-8as-ei-exf.jpg) | 325.28 KB |
author: detaildude

comments.content: Sean, you should learn to distinguish Arial’s |S|: [http://typophile.com/node/120984#comment-592387](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317181250/http:/typophile.com/node/120984#comment-592387 "http://typophile.com/node/120984#comment-592387")

I suggested Myriad over Frutiger mainly because the visible angle between terminals of |S| and stems of |H| and |I|: in Frutiger they’re virtually parallel, while in Myriad they diverge in a more pronounced way.

But then, again, the dot in Myriad’s bang is circular…  
Softmaker’s knock-off of Frutiger has a similar |S|, but not enough space between stem and dot in the bang.

Myriad’s |B| is much more rounded than the one on the sample (the bowls have little to no flat portion, top and bottom). That and the exclamation point led me to Frutiger:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317181250im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Myriad_4257.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317181250im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Frutiger_6469.png)

Hello,

thanks to all for your input. I opted for Frutiger Cond Black now, which looks accurate in my eyese. I ruled out Myriad Pro too, being the default font of Illustrator. But I forgot to check Frutiger.

Thanks once more!  
C.
